comment: Cauchy's Mean Value Theorem. If ` F , G ` are real continuous functions on ` [ A , B ] ` differentiable on ` ( A , B ) ` , then there is some ` x e. ( A , B ) ` such that ` F ` ' ` ( x ) / G ` ' ` ( x ) = ` ` ( F ( A ) - F ( B ) ) / ( G ( A ) - G ( B ) ) ` . (We express the condition without division, so that we need no nonzero constraints.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 29-Dec-2016.)
